column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Worked great for my allergies, but due to my extreme sensitivity to pretty much every allergen, I was on this, and similar medications for almost 7 years every day.  Do not ignore the potential for mood changes, mental state of mind changes, outbursts or anxiety- these are very real and ruined my marriage.  I've been off this stuff for 2 weeks and feel different. Yes, my allergies are terrible, but I'm treating with natural methods.  This drug made my body change including facial swelling around the eyes.  Since I've been "free" I have not had any outbursts, or mood changes.  Too bad it's probably too late to save my marriage.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: vivianaclaffy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
bamaman, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: As with others, it cleared up my allergy symptoms within a few days of starting it, But I had a headache, jitters, and nausea. These side effects were worse when I stopped the meds for 1-2 days.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Definitely has helped with my allergies and symptoms, but I have been making the mistake of taking it before bed and have not been able to stay asleep. I also feel hot at night. It seems like there has been many accounts of this happening, so don't take it at night!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this drug this yesterday and this morning for congestion and I am having insomnia, I feel very weak and tired, I had trouble focusing at work, I feel dizzy, and my heart is pounding.

column2: Fox, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used the medicine last night and slept like a baby. I only have this lingering cough. Ughh I guess I'll have to call the doctor. :(

column2: Boedacious, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Having an allergic reaction, face is swelling and face is forehead are red.  No previous allergies.

column2: lisa, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Take the 12 hour treatment instead of 24 hour and don't take it before bedtime... you won't sleep a wink!  My heart and mind were both racing all night long!

column2: Robin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was struggling with cold symptoms for 3 days(watery, itchy eyes, running nose and congestion) hoping that the virus would run it's course and get over soon with lots of rest.  Unfortunately, the symptoms worsened by the end of the 3rd day. My husband bought Claritin-D 24 hour for me.  I took it at 6 in the evening and had relief of symptoms shortly after taking.  I felt great and wished I would have started it 3 days earlier.  The only problem is that I could not sleep a wink.  It is now 24 hours later and the symptoms are starting to return.  I am afraid to take it again. I may hold off tonight and consider taking 1/2 tablet as soon as I wake in the morning.

column2: 12SBOJV, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine does its job: stops my sneezing,itching and eye-watering, and clears out my sinuses which relieves some of the pressure and helps with the headaches.  The only negative thing is that it makes me restless....i took it the first time at 10pm and didn't sleep at all that night (my own stupid mistake since it has a high dose of pseudoephedrine) I've started taking it in the morning, and only when i really, really need it.  It helps.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My husband & i took the 24 hr claritin pills at 11am. That night we did not sleep at all, not a bit.:(

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have seasonal and non seasonal allergies. I also get sinus infections 2-3 times a year. This is the only medication I have found that works to clear up sinus dranage. Works great for itchy watery eyes and sneezing also. I only take it when I have severe symptoms. Otherwis my body seems to get immune to it.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Red Dragonfly, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: Over-night relieved my severe alleric reaction to pollens & dust on over grown brush/trees at an institution for deaf/blind clients. I could not attend conference for 3 days due to severe allergy attack. Available over the counter, it is the only medicine I choose and know I will get fast relief.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took the medication at 1pm in the afternoon, and that night I only slept a total of 30 minutes. I layed in bed from 9pm until 5am (when I had to get up for work).

column2: dace duffy, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: this is prabably one of the best over the coun ter dug the you can by for seasonal and non seasonal alergies i suffer from watering eyes and conjestion of the nose and when i take this pill i feel as if nothin were wrong with me to began this i highly recommend this drug

column2: the silver fox, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It beats anything I have used in recent years,my stuffy nose,is unstuffed,and thats good enough for me

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on regular Claritin for months for allergies and it did nothing, so my doctor suggested I try Claritin-D. It works great on most of my symptoms, but I have to take it first think in the morning, or else I can't sleep. Other side effects I experienced are slight restlessness (just feels like more energy), and slight loss of appetite (I'm on a diet at the moment, so both are actually beneficial, but I am keeping a close eye on both side effects in case they increase in intensity).

column2: anonymous, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have seasonal and non-seasonal allergies. Claritin D helps a great deal with my symptoms but does not completely alleviate all of my symptoms at all times.  I would recommend it to seasonal allergy sufferers.

column2: Jodi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After taking this medicine...extreme tiredness, sleeplessness, dry mouth, just plain don't feel good.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've taken Claritin D 24 Hr daily by prescription for about 15 years & have avoided getting sinus & bronchial infections that typically follow congestion caused by my allergies. It did rais my pulse and blood pressure a little, but they're still slightly below "normal". Otherwise, I've had no negative side effects.

column2: Bluecat2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't feel sick, this is not a cold that I have.  Did not work at all.  No side effects, nothing.  If anything, made the congestion worse.  Large pill to swallow.

column2: clogged1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have to take the 24-hour version at about noon, or I can't sleep at night.   The decongestant wears off somewhat by evening, but my sinuses are still better than they would be without medication.

column2: Marcus, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have chronic allergies.  The swelled jowles, inflamed sinus, and generally cold like symptoms.  This stuff works.  I want to report that I can not take this medicine as much as I need to, however, because it causes extreme erectile dysfunction.  No way can I get a rise after taking the stuff.  The other side effects are not nearly as intrusive and obvious as the ED.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: ThumpBlump, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Claritin-D 12 hour, one tab in the morning, for five days, and now I have had an irregular heartbeat for the past three months. This drug is bad news, and I am having difficulty seeing a caregive in the fear that I will now have a preexisiting heart condition. BEWARE OF THIS DRUG!!!

column2: jr78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Worked for my throat problems, but terrible side effects: general jitters, then a feeling of extreme sleepiness, followed by a feeling that it is harder to take deep breath.

column2: Tiger, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: For the past 8 months, I have had frequent stuffiness/sneezing/even chest congestion. My doctor suggested I might have developed an allergy to something.  A relative suggested Claritin D and it has been a miracle!  I'm finally able to breathe freely, stop using tissues by the box, and feel GOOD.  Side effects: Perhaps a slight decrease in appetite and restlessness, which could be also described as more energy.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
abcd, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i been using this since last two years,it releves my stuffy nose,sore throat etc.,but couple of days back i was traveling to alabama and i got worse allergie symptoms,now after long term use its not really effective to me

column2: jjrn13, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've suffered severe allergies all my life (I'm now 57).After years of shots and medications, I gave up trying to fight it long ago.My son recently raved about this med so I tried it. I can honestly say this is the first time I can honestly say my syptoms are virtually gone. The slight dry mouth is a small price to pay for being able to breath for the first time in I can't remember when.Taking a med once a day could not be more convenient.

column2: PORSHE, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
GRGKB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have sinusitis ans this drug has relieved my congestion, but with the side effects of dry mouth and dizziness. I have also experienced a headache, but this could just be from the sinus pressure and not a direct effect from the drug.

column2: Raiven, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My symptoms were cleared up but I had a very bad reaction to this medicine. Experienced all possible side effects in a big way. Dry mouth, headache, nervousness, upset stomache, etc.

column2: Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Debbi J., 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug works great in clearing up my runny nose symptoms but it's too much of a stimulant to get a good night's rest.  I would not recommend this to anyone who works the night shift.  It doesn't allow you to sleep for an extended period of time.

column2: way2be, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Almost immediate improvement of scratchy/sore throat, sinus congestion.  Decongestion effects seemed to wear off after couple weeks but still helpful.  Decreased need to use exedrin for severe sinus headaches.  Increased alertness and felt somewhat keyed up (but not agitated).  Decreased overall need for rest/sleep, including much later bedtime and no weekend napping...huge change for me.  Restless sleep but easy waking.  Changes/fluctuations in mood noticed, including increased needless worry/obsessing.  Overall, drug seems helpful but with noticeable (some helpful, others not so helpful) side effects.

column2: angief18, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started yesterday and today I feel very emotional. Last night had nightmares and very bad sleep. I feel tense and not myself. Was not able to concentrate at work so I had to come home. I have never experienced such side efects with a medication. It worked great for my allegy symptoms but other than that it has been an unpleasant experience. Also the nurse at work took my blood preasure and it was 150/80 which mine is usually low between 90/60. I also have a bad headache.

column2: melrn1122, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: One hour after taking it my allergies started to get better.  However,  I did suffer from loss of sleep.

column2: acynfulmind, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had sinusitis, acute otitis media, and an upper respitory infection. Along with an antibiotic, my symptoms improved dramatically in 4 days. I'm extremely pleased with the results from this drug.

column2: Andyk, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: This is the only medication that has allowed me to finally be able to breath easier. I have been so stuffed up my face sometimes feels swollen.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am taking Claritin D for the inflamation from chronic Sinusitis. I have had excellent results. Decreased inflamation, decreased facial pain.

column2: billy who, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it has helped my runny nose

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Works very well to alleviate my allergy symptoms. Definite side effects of loss of appetite and general jitters. Sometimes can cause sleeplessness. Also if taken many days in a row it is less effective.

column2: wammers, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Can this medication when taken every day show up in a drug test as amphetamine?

column2: sunlovertoo, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my first day on it, and I have dried up considerably.  Only side effect so far is occasional chills.  I have terrible allergies, so it's worth the chills and being in 90 degree Florida, it's a good thing!
